stimulusHtml: Which of the following best explains why the Soviet bloc experienced significant periods of unrest during the Cold War?

features.html: The following question refers to the topic of two emerging superpowers.

choicesHtml: Soviet economic production goals led to specialized production among bloc members, limiting economic development.
Catholic and other Christian religious leaders frequently spoke out against communist policies, leading to increasing religious zeal.
Soviet central planning boosted industrial production, but limited individual freedoms and failed to provide the consumer goods present in the West.
Rival communist thinkers, such as Marshal Tito in Yugoslavia, accused the Soviets of failing to adhere to the principles of Marxism.
